title: Transport in plants and animals: capture of nutrients in plants and animals
creator_contributor_role: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant physiology
description: 1. "Transport in plants and animals". Explains how plants and animals transport their nutritional requirements internally. Similarities and differences between the transport methods are discussed. 2. "Capture of nutrients in plants and animals". Every living organism needs a method of taking nutrients and of spelling waste products. This program examines which nutrients are esential to plants and animals and compares the system used to achieve this exchange of substances.
